 # Tensors

+The central unit of data in TensorFlow is the **tensor**. The formal physicist's and
body:
Some physicists can be very formal, but I don't think we need to go into this :-)

Jokes aside, I am not sure this clarification is particularly useful for most users of tensorflow, and I think that introducing more formal concepts like "map" and "basis" here will confuse more users than it will help. I think the users who know what those terms mean will also know that the concrete "tensors" in TensorFlow would be a representation of an abstract tensor in a particular basis.

body_text:
Some physicists can be very formal, but I don't think we need to go into this :-)
Jokes aside, I am not sure this clarification is particularly useful for most users of tensorflow, and I think that introducing more formal concepts like "map" and "basis" here will confuse more users than it will help. I think the users who know what those terms mean will also know that the concrete "tensors" in TensorFlow would be a representation of an abstract tensor in a particular basis.
